column5: Saw you had some bad weather down there you Ok?
Was just gonna post the same question,Paul.Let us know how its goin. Joe
Joe just watching the news guess parts of bama got hit hard, some on there about people trapped in a school used as a shelter. LOL not that the swamp rat would go to school! LOL

CNN just reported about 13 have died in Alabama as a result of the storms.  Also reported that in Enterprise Alabama, a school took a direct hit with 8 people killed in the school.  The pictures coming over the tube are unbelievable !!!  Hey GCD ... let us know your OK buddy.     Our prayers go out to the people of Alabama.
Bama and Kansas both hit hard. Saying most spouts they've ever seen spawned out of one storm...and in March no less.  Dawg'll be fine... Don't make a liar out of me bud!
Ya more on the news know here also didn`t hear about the deaths on the first report. Sad to hear it!
nasty nasty stuff.  i think i will take the snow anyday!
OK  Glen is ONLINE!!!!!!!!!
Would it have been too much freakin' trouble to pickup a phone and call your Bubba, Bubba??? eh?
I'm ok I'm ok! Thanks for the concern and askin'!!!... Ya gotta love the OFC family!
glad to hear your ok, sounds like bama took a hard pounding today,  our prayers go out to everyone that lost property, and especially the ones who lost loved ones.  jason
Just got home and saw the amage. Man..nasty stuff. Hope this isn't a precursor for this summer! Glad to hear you is okay, redneck!
yes it looks like bama,was hit extremly hard with alot of people dead according to CNN,glad your ok glen....and im sorry about all those kids killed in their school,......sad day
where have you been .....? We have been worried sick!!!! Joe
Glad your okay G.  Any damage near you?  Joey

Good to hear you made it thru the storm OK Glen !!  I thought WE were getting clobbered bad up here yesterday till I put the news on and saw what was happening down your way.  I've been thru 4 hurricanes, but have never seen a tornado, and hope to keep it that way.  Keep your head up Bud.

Thanks again for the concern folks. Just minimal damage around my area, a few trees down. 90% of the deadly stuff hit L.A. (Lower Alabama).. less than 100 miles from the Gulf coast, the other 10% was just west of Montgomery (still 100 miles away from me).  I've been thru several Hurricanes before too Lew, and 1 tornado (a small F1 or 2) and the shear raw power of the tornado is both frightening and amazing, and over shadows the hurricanes.

Glen, 3 of the hurricanes I encountered were on the ocean and although they don't cause any damage out there, the sight of 60 - 70 foot waves crashing over your ship can be a little daunting, to say the least.  Those tornadoes are a totally different story though, when they just drop outta the sky like that with absolutely no warning at all......terrifying stuff !!

Glad to hear yer doin fine Glen.  Nasty weather all around last night. Barrie had power outages all night,and the roads SUCK.  Woke up to freezing rain this morning.Storm looks to be clearing out up here.Perry Sound and Huntsville are to get another 10-20 today.   Care out there peoples.
Glad to hear you are OK Glen. I have friends in Montgomery, I'll have to try to give them a call today.
Glad to hear you're okay Glen.  Regards, Sam
I cant believe yall were worried about Glen he's got more wind than any tornado I hear of. We are still glad you are OK though bud.  Art
Glen alright? Nope never has been
nice to here your doing ok Glen. That was a real nasty storm. We should all keep those familes in mind that lost loved ones.
